# LiteMap - Project Instructions

## Project Overview
LiteMap is a lightweight Google Maps alternative UI designed for an HCI (Human-Computer Interaction) course final project.

## Tech Stack
- **Framework**: React 19
- **Build Tool**: Vite
- **Styling**: CSS3 with CSS Variables

## Project Structure
```
my-react-app/
├── src/
│   ├── components/
│   │   ├── Header/      # Navigation & search
│   │   ├── Sidebar/     # Side panel with tabs
│   │   └── MapView/     # Map canvas & controls
│   ├── App.jsx          # Main application
│   ├── App.css          # Layout styles
│   └── index.css        # Global styles
├── DESIGN_DOCUMENTATION.md  # Full design docs
└── README.md            # Project overview
```

## Commands
- `npm run dev` - Start development server
- `npm run build` - Build for production
- `npm run preview` - Preview production build

## Design Focus
- Interaction types: Manipulating & Instructing
- Responsive design (Desktop, Tablet, Mobile)
- Accessibility compliant
- Clean, modern aesthetic

## Documentation
See DESIGN_DOCUMENTATION.md for complete design decisions, interaction patterns, and annotations.

Before starting a new task in the above plan, update progress in the plan.
